column5: hi guys so with 'the season' a couple weeks away..(finally!), just curious where and what you guys will be targeting? largemouth or smallmouth? general location? cheers Rich
Long Point Bay - Smallies and Largies
smallies on the kawartha's
It's looking like Largemouth on Lake Seymour with a buddy haha, so pumped!
largies and smallies on Lake X.. bu ta week later
Top water smallies at the camp north of Sudbury.  I really can't wait!
Smallies here, but Buckets are more than welcome as well.....
I'll be going for Largemouth.  Boy oh boy i can't wait.  This year i teach myself how to pitch jigs so i'm excited to catch my first fish using this technique.
Likewise. For me, I'll probably be up somewhere in the Kawartha's, and as for the largies vs smallies, I'll go for both, I don't discriminate!
Smallmouth on Georgian Bay near Parry Sound.
x2

I'm probably gonna try for Largemouth in Eastern Ontario. Going to be throwing some frogs, jitterbugs in thick slop! Probably will be taking my pitching and flipping skills to the test once the topwater bite is over! I am VERY EXCITED.
either or   grand and thames and anywhere else I can find em
Grey Bruce area for Smallies 1st then Largies, start my holiday's that day yawho can't wait
Smallies in Muskoka here.
sounds like everyone is pretty pumped for this year, including myself! I think I will be hunting largies on Gloucester Pool....            Thanks: Kistler rods, Elk River Jigs, Whopper Baits

I love my North Kawartha area, so it will be surface LMBass in the AM then maybe some SMBass on Senko's or Crank's later in the day. Of coarse if the Smallies want to eat my poppers or toads, they are more than welcome too.
Largies, in the Haliburtons.
It looks like I might not get my chance after all.  My wife made plans for me to go visit friends in Pembroke.  Any good shore fishing spots up there?
Smallies on Simcoe.
I will be going for both on an undisclosed lake.  Probably end up with some small largemouth and some larger smallmouth.
Bass come in season on the last day of my Pike/Muskie/Walleye - Lake Nipissing fishing trip.... I will be fishing hard for them a few hours before I have to leave.
